title: Football: The five official FIFA presidential candidates
text:
Football: The five official FIFA presidential candidates 
CCTV.com Share this: Share on twitter Share on facebook Share on sinaweibo Share on email Font size: 
Top of the order is football news from off the pitch, as this is the last day candidates wanting to run for FIFA presidency can submit the five federation nominations required to enter the race to succeed Sepp Blatter as the head of the sport's governing body.The President of the Asian Football Confederation, Sheikh Salman Bin Ebrahim Al Khalifa, formally entered the race on Sunday. The Bahraini is closely allied with Kuwaiti Sheikh Ahmad Al-Fahad Al-Sabah, one of the most powerful men in international sports politics, and a key figure in the Olympic movement.Sheikh Salman had initially backed Michel Platini, the UEFA President. But the Frenchman was handed a 90-day provisional ban from football by FIFA's Ethics Committee. Platini could later be let back into the race, if he is successful in overturning the judgement.Also running are Jordanian Prince Ali Bin Al Hussein, South African former Apartheid-era political prisoner turned businessman Tokyo Sexwale, former Trinidad and Tobago midfielder David Nakhid, and former FIFA Deputy Secretary-General Jerome Champagne, with an entry also expected from former Brazil midfielder and coach Zico.
